Projects List

MarketMaker

Automated Cryptocurrency Trading System | November 2025

Deployed an AWS Python bot, with a custom backtesting framework, using mean reversion, SMA crossover, and regime-switching strategies to identify optimal entry and exit points in crypto markets.

Built and deployed a comprehensive crypto trading system on AWS using Python. The system combines mean reversion, SMA crossover, and regime-switching strategies to identify optimal entry and exit points across crypto markets. Integrated the Kraken API for real-time data and developed a custom backtesting framework to validate performance across multiple market conditions and cryptocurrencies.

Bookagement

Book Management System | May 2024

Developed a web-based book management system with Python (Flask) and SQLite for the back-end and data storage using technologies such as Jinja, HTML, and CSS used to implement an ergonomic and responsive UI.

Status: 100% Complete

Thermal ToDo's

Daily Management Scripting Project | February 2024

Set up a Linux script interfacing with a thermal receipt printer via the ESC POS protocol. Integrated multiple APIs and protocols, including Google's OAuth 2.0 to retrieve, format and print out the data as small receipt-like ToDo's.

GPoznanS

API Visualizaion Web App | August 2023

The project is a data visualization web app based around the streamlit rapid development library for python. It utilizes the free APIs shared by the city of Poznan to pinpoint the location of certain crucial points on the city map. The project also uses streamlit's folium component which makes the map a lot more detailed and easy to work with in comparison to other streamlit map objects.

Solar & Lunar Playing Cards

Custom Deck of Playing Cards | October 2019

As part of my middle school final project I designed and produced 50 custom prototype decks of playing cards. The cards were produced by the largest card company in the world Cartamundi and use their standard True Linen B9 finish.

The cards designs are based on very simple geometric shapes (triangles and circles) which when combined make up all of the more complex design elements on the card faces. This project was my first attempt at designing something digital and then getting it into production which ultimately left me with a physical product as an outcome of my work.

As an additional challenge I decided to use this opportunity to plan out a possible crowdfunding campaign around the product.
